tables.name: adt_occurrence
tables.description: The adt_occurrence table contains information about distinct admission, discharge, or transfer events that occur as part of a clinical visit.

fields.name: adt_date
fields.description: The date of the adt event

fields.name: adt_datetime
fields.description: The datetime of the adt event

fields.name: adt_occurrence_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each ADT event.

fields.name: adt_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to an adt event type concept identifier in the vocabulary. This concept describes the type of the adt event."

fields.name: adt_type_source_value
fields.description: The source data used to identify the adt event type

fields.name: care_site_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the care site in which this adt event occurred.

fields.name: next_adt_occurrence_id
fields.description: Foreign key into the adt_occurrence table pointing to the ADT record immediately following this record in the event stream for the visit. Must be populated for all but the last ADT even within a visit.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person for whom the visit is recorded.

fields.name: prior_adt_occurrence_id
fields.description: Foreign key into the adt_occurrence table pointing to the ADT record immediately preceding this record in the event stream for the visit. Must be populated for all but the first ADT even within a visit.

fields.name: service_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a adt event service concept identifier in the vocabulary. This concept describes the type of service associated with this adt event."

fields.name: service_source_value
fields.description: The source data used to derive the service type for this event. It will typically be a department code from the ADT event.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the visit containing this event.

tables.name: care_site
tables.description: Information about the site of care

fields.name: care_site_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each defined location of care within an organization. Here, an organization is defined as a collection of one or more care sites that share a single EHR database.

fields.name: care_site_name
fields.description: The description of the care site

fields.name: care_site_source_value
fields.description: The identifier for the organization in the source data, stored here for reference.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the geographic location of the administrative offices of the organization in the location table, where the detailed address information is stored.

fields.name: place_of_service_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a place of service concept identifier in the Vocabulary

fields.name: place_of_service_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the place of service as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

fields.name: specialty_concept_id
fields.description: The specialty of the department linked to a standard specialty concept as it appears in the Vocabulary

fields.name: specialty_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the specialty as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

tables.name: cohort
tables.description: COHORT table contains records of subjects that satisfy a given set of criteria for a duration of time and the definition of the cohort is contained within the COHORT_DEFINITION table

fields.name: cohort_definition_id
fields.description: It is the unique identifier for a given cohort (e.g., arm of a clinical trial)

fields.name: cohort_end_date
fields.description: date for end of trial

fields.name: cohort_end_datetime
fields.description: datetime for end of trial

fields.name: cohort_start_date
fields.description: date for start of enrollment in trial

fields.name: cohort_start_datetime
fields.description: datetime for start of enrollment in trial

fields.name: subject_id
fields.description: patient enrolled in trial

fields.name: withdraw_date
fields.description: date of clinical trial withdrawal

fields.name: withdraw_datetime
fields.description: datetime of clinical trial withdrawal

tables.name: cohort_definition
tables.description: maintains the rules governing the inclusion of a subject into a cohort

fields.name: cohort_definition_description
fields.description: long description of the cohort

fields.name: cohort_definition_id
fields.description: the unique identifier for a given cohort

fields.name: cohort_definition_name
fields.description: short description of the cohort

fields.name: cohort_definition_syntax
fields.description: additional syntax

fields.name: cohort_initiation_date
fields.description: date of most recent data extraction for cohort enrollment

fields.name: definition_type_concept_id
fields.description: type of cohort

fields.name: subject_concept_id
fields.description: person for current use cases

tables.name: concept
tables.description: The CONCEPT table contains records that uniquely identify each fundamental unit of meaning used to express clinical information. Concepts are derived from source vocabularies, which represent clinical information across different domains (e.g. conditions, drugs, procedures) through the use of source codes and associated descriptions. Some concepts are designated as standard concepts, meaning these concepts can be used within the OMOP Common Data Model and within standardized analytics. Each standard concept has a primary domain, which defines the location where the concept would be expected to be observed within OMOP Common Data Model.

fields.name: concept_class_id
fields.description: The category or class of the concept along both the hierarchical tree as well as different domains within a vocabulary. Examples are Clinical Drug, Ingredient, Clinical Finding etc.

fields.name: concept_code
fields.description: The concept code represents the identifier of the concept in the source data it originates from, such as SNOMED-CT concept IDs, RxNorm RXCUIs etc. Note that concept codes are not unique across vocabularies.

fields.name: concept_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each concept across all domains.

fields.name: concept_name
fields.description: An unambiguous, meaningful and descriptive name for the concept.

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The domain a concept belongs to.

fields.name: invalid_reason
fields.description: Reason the concept was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

fields.name: standard_concept
fields.description: This flag determines where a concept is a Standard Concept, i.e. is used in the data, a class concept, or a non-standard concept. The allowables values for standard_concept are: 'S' for Standard Concept, 'C' for a Class Concept, otherwise the content is null for non-standard concepts, including source concepts. Standard Concepts (S) may appear in CDM tables in CONCEPT_ID fields, whereas Class concepts (C) should not appear in the CDM data, but participate in the CONCEPT_ANCESTOR and can be used to identify descendants that may appear in the data. Non-standard concepts can only appear in SOURCE_CONCEPT_ID fields and are not used in CONCEPT_ANCESTOR.

fields.name: valid_end_date
fields.description: The date when the concept became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new concept. The default value is 31-Dec-2099.

fields.name: valid_start_date
fields.description: The date when the concept was first recorded.

fields.name: vocabulary_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the vocabulary table indicating from which source the concept has been adapted.

tables.name: concept_ancestor
tables.description: The CONCEPT_ANCESTOR table contains records that define the inferred hierarchical relationships between all standard concepts. The concept ancestor table is fully derived from the concept, CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP, and relationship tables, whereby all ancestor-descendant relationships can be inferred from traversing all parent-child relationships between standard concepts. The concept ancestor table includes records for all parent-child relationships, as well as grandparent-grandchild relationships and additional levels of lineage. The concept ancestor table enables efficient identification of multi-step hierarchical relationships, such as branded drugs that fall within a therapeutic class or specific diagnosis that are classified within a particular system organ class.

fields.name: ancestor_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept code in the concept table for the higher-level concept that forms the ancestor in the relationship.

fields.name: descendant_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept code in the concept table for the lower-level concept that forms the descendant in the relationship.

fields.name: max_levels_of_separation
fields.description: The maximum separation in number of levels of hierarchy between ancestor and descendant concepts. This is an optional attribute that is used to simplify hierarchic analysis.

fields.name: min_levels_of_separation
fields.description: The minimum separation in number of levels of hierarchy between ancestor and descendant concepts. This is an optional attribute that is used to simplify hierarchic analysis.

tables.name: concept_class
tables.description: The CONCEPT_CLASS table includes a list of the classifications used to differentiate concepts within a given vocabulary. This reference table is populated with a single record for each concept class and includes a descriptive name for the concept class.

fields.name: concept_class_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Class the record belongs to.

fields.name: concept_class_id
fields.description: A unique key for each class.

fields.name: concept_class_name
fields.description: The name describing the Concept Class, e.g. "Clinical Finding", "Ingredient", etc.

tables.name: concept_relationship
tables.description: The CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table contains records that define direct relationships between any two concepts and the nature of the relationship. The type of relationship is defined in the Relationship table, and is generally classified as hierarchical (parent-child) or non-hierarchical (lateral). All relationships are directional, and each concept relationship is represented twice symmetrically within the concept relationship table. 'Acute myocardial infarction of the anterior wall'and 'Acute myocardial infarction'have two concept relationships: 1- 'Acute myocardial infarction of the anterior wall"is a"Acute myocardial infarction', and 2- 'Acute myocardial infarction"subsumes"Acute myocardial infarction of the anterior wall'

fields.name: concept_id_1
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept in the concept table associated with the relationship. Relationships are directional, and this field represents the source concept designation.

fields.name: concept_id_2
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept in the concept table associated with the relationship. Relationships are directional, and this field represents the destination concept designation.

fields.name: invalid_reason
fields.description: Reason the relationship was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

fields.name: relationship_id
fields.description: The type of relationship as defined in the relationship table.

fields.name: valid_end_date
fields.description: The date when the relationship became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new relationship. Default value is 31-Dec-2099.

fields.name: valid_start_date
fields.description: The date when the instance of the relationship is first recorded.

tables.name: concept_synonym
tables.description: The CONCEPT_SYNONYM table is used to store alternate names and descriptions for a concept. Each synonym is assigned its own unique identifier and contains the text of a description and the identifier of the concept that it represents.

fields.name: concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept in the concept table.

fields.name: concept_synonym_name
fields.description: The alternative name for the concept.

fields.name: language_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept representing the language.

tables.name: condition_era
tables.description: A Condition Era is defined as a span of time when the Person is assumed to have a given condition.

fields.name: condition_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard Condition Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

fields.name: condition_era_end_date
fields.description: The end date for the Condition Era constructed from the individual instances of Condition Occurrences. It is the end date of the final continuously recorded instance of the Condition.

fields.name: condition_era_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each Condition Era.

fields.name: condition_era_start_date
fields.description: The start date for the Condition Era constructed from the individual instances of Condition Occurrences. It is the start date of the very first chronologically recorded instance of the condition.

fields.name: condition_occurrence_count
fields.description: The number of individual Condition Occurrences used to construct the condition era.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is experiencing the Condition during the Condition Era. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

tables.name: condition_occurrence
tables.description: A diagnosis or condition that has been recorded about a person at a certain time

fields.name: condition_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard condition concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: condition_end_date
fields.description: The date when the instance of the condition is considered to have ended. If this information is not available, set to NULL.

fields.name: condition_end_datetime
fields.description: The date and time when the instance of the condition is considered to have ended

fields.name: condition_occurrence_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each condition occurrence event.

fields.name: condition_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a condition concept that refers to the code used in the source

fields.name: condition_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the condition as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard condition concept in the Vocabulary and the original code is, stored here for reference. Condition source codes are typically ICD-9-CM diagnosis codes from medical claims or discharge status/visit diagnosis codes from EHRs.

fields.name: condition_start_date
fields.description: The date when the instance of the condition is recorded.

fields.name: condition_start_datetime
fields.description: The date and time when the instance of the condition is recorded.

fields.name: condition_status_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the standard vocabulary reflecting the condition status.

fields.name: condition_status_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the condition status as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: condition_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept identifier in the Vocabulary reflecting the source data from which the condition was recorded, the level of standardization, and the type of occurrence. For example, conditions may be defined as primary or secondary diagnoses, problem lists and person statuses.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who is experiencing the condition. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: poa_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to value in the source for that determines if the diagnosis is present on admission.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was responsible for determining (diagnosing) the condition.

fields.name: stop_reason
fields.description: The reason, if available, that the condition was no longer recorded, as indicated in the source data. Valid values include discharged, resolved, etc. Note that a stop_reason does not necessarily imply that the condition is no longer occurring.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the condition was determined (diagnosed).

tables.name: death
tables.description: Time and cause of death of the Person

fields.name: cause_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key referring to a standard concept identifier in the Vocabulary for conditions.

fields.name: cause_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the vocbaulary concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: cause_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the cause of death as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard concept in the Vocabulary and the original code is, stored here for reference.

fields.name: death_cause_id
fields.description: The primary key for the death table.

fields.name: death_date
fields.description: The date the person was deceased. If the precise date including day or month is not known or not allowed, December is used as the default month, and the last day of the month the default day. If no date available, use date recorded as deceased.

fields.name: death_datetime
fields.description: The date the person was deceased.

fields.name: death_impute_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key referring to a standard concept identifier in the vocabulary for death imputation.

fields.name: death_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key referring to the predefined concept identifier in the Vocabulary reflecting how the death was represented in the source data.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the deceased person. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

tables.name: device_exposure
tables.description: The Device domain captures information about a person's exposure to a foreign physical object or instrument which is used for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes through a mechanism beyond chemical action.

fields.name: device_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies belonging to the Device domain.

fields.name: device_exposure_end_date
fields.description: The date use of the Device or supply was ceased.

fields.name: device_exposure_end_datetime
fields.description: The date and time use of the Device or supply was ceased.

fields.name: device_exposure_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each Device Exposure.

fields.name: device_exposure_start_date
fields.description: The date the Device or supply was applied or used.

fields.name: device_exposure_start_datetime
fields.description: The date and time the Device or supply was applied or used.

fields.name: device_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a Device Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: device_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the Device as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a Standard Device Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

fields.name: device_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of Device Exposure recorded.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Device. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

fields.name: placement_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the body site where the device was placed.

fields.name: placement_source_value
fields.description: The body site where the device was placed in the source system.

fields.name: production_id
fields.description: The PI portion of the UDI or equivalent identifying the instance of the Device used in the Person.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the PROVIDER table who initiated or administered the Device.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of individual Devices used in the exposure.

fields.name: unique_device_id
fields.description: A UDI or equivalent identifying the instance of the Device used in the Person.

fields.name: unit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of device units in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: unit_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of measurement units in the Vocabulary as it appears in the source.

fields.name: unit_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the unit as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard unit concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the visit associated with the device_exposure record.

tables.name: domain
tables.description: The DOMAIN table includes a list of the domains of data elements that are contained within the OMOP common data model. A domain defines the set of allowable concepts for each standardized field. This reference table is populated with a single record for each domain and includes a descriptive name for the Domain.

fields.name: domain_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Domain the Domain record belongs to.

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: A unique key for each domain.

fields.name: domain_name
fields.description: The name describing the Domain, e.g. "Condition", "Procedure", "Measurement" etc.

tables.name: dose_era
tables.description: A Dose Era is defined as a span of time when the Person is assumed to be exposed to a constant dose of a specific active ingredient.

fields.name: dose_era_end_date
fields.description: The end date for the drug era constructed from the individual instance of drug exposures. It is the end date of the final continuously recorded instance of utilization of a drug.

fields.name: dose_era_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each Dose Era.

fields.name: dose_era_start_date
fields.description: The start date for the drug era constructed from the individual instances of drug exposures. It is the start date of the very first chronologically recorded instance of utilization of a drug.

fields.name: dose_value
fields.description: The numeric value of the dose.

fields.name: drug_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the active Ingredient Concept.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the drug during the drug era. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

fields.name: unit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the unit concept.

tables.name: drug_era
tables.description: A Drug Era is defined as a span of time when the Person is assumed to be exposed to a particular active ingredient.

fields.name: drug_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Ingredient Concept.

fields.name: drug_era_end_date
fields.description: The end date for the drug era constructed from the individual instance of drug exposures. It is the end date of the final continuously recorded instance of utilization of a drug.

fields.name: drug_era_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each Drug Era.

fields.name: drug_era_start_date
fields.description: The start date for the Drug Era constructed from the individual instances of Drug Exposures. It is the start date of the very first chronologically recorded instance of conutilization of a Drug.

fields.name: drug_exposure_count
fields.description: The number of individual Drug Exposure occurrences used to construct the Drug Era.

fields.name: gap_days
fields.description: The number of days that are not covered by DRUG_EXPOSURE records that were used to make up the era record.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Drug during the fDrug Era. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

tables.name: drug_exposure
tables.description: The drug exposure domain captures any biochemical substance that is introduced in any way to a patient.

fields.name: days_supply
fields.description: The number of days of supply the medication as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record

fields.name: dispense_as_written_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to value in the source for that determines if the medication is to be dispensed as written.

fields.name: dose_unit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a predefined concept in the Standard Vocabularies reflecting the unit the effective drug_dose value is expressed

fields.name: dose_unit_source_value
fields.description: The information about the dose unit as detailed in the source

fields.name: drug_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard drug concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: drug_exposure_end_date
fields.description: The end date for the current instance of drug utilization. It is not available from all sources.

fields.name: drug_exposure_end_datetime
fields.description: The end date and time of the utilization of the drug

fields.name: drug_exposure_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each drug utilization event.

fields.name: drug_exposure_order_date
fields.description: The order date of the drug

fields.name: drug_exposure_order_datetime
fields.description: The order date and time of the drug

fields.name: drug_exposure_start_date
fields.description: The start date for the current instance of drug utilization. Valid entries include a start date of a prescription, the date a prescription was filled, or the date on which a drug administration procedure was recorded.

fields.name: drug_exposure_start_datetime
fields.description: The start date and time of the utilization of the drug. The start date of the prescription, the date the prescription was filled, the date a drug was dispensed or the date on which a drug administration procedure was recorded are acceptable.

fields.name: drug_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a drug concept that refers to the code used in the source

fields.name: drug_source_value
fields.description: The source drug value as it appears in the source data. The source is mapped to a standard RxNorm concept and the original code is stored here for reference.

fields.name: drug_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of the type of drug exposure in the Vocabulary as represented in the source data

fields.name: eff_drug_dose_source_value
fields.description: The drug dose for this drug_exposure record as it appears in the source

fields.name: effective_drug_dose
fields.description: Numerical value of drug dose for this drug_exposure record

fields.name: frequency
fields.description: The discrete frequency information as available from the source

fields.name: lot_number
fields.description: An identifier to determine where the product originated

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who is subjected to the drug. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who initiated (prescribed) the drug exposure

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the drugs as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record

fields.name: refills
fields.description: The number of refills after the initial prescrition

fields.name: route_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard administration route concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: route_source_value
fields.description: The information about the route of administration as detailed in the source

fields.name: sig
fields.description: The directions on the drug prescription as recorded in the original prescription (and printed on the container) or the dispensing record

fields.name: stop_reason
fields.description: The reason, if available, where the medication was stopped, as indicated in the source data.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the drug exposure initiated.

tables.name: drug_iv_pilot
tables.description: Table used for piloting the extraction of all continuous infusion MAR entires in order to derive the infused fluid volume

fields.name: days_supply
fields.description: The number of days of supply the medication as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record

fields.name: dispense_as_written_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to value in the source for that determines if the medication is to be dispensed as written.

fields.name: dose_infusion_rate
fields.description: The numerical rate value of the continuous infusion.

fields.name: dose_infusion_rate_units
fields.description: The unit associated with the rate of the continuous infusion.

fields.name: dose_unit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a predefined concept in the Standard Vocabularies reflecting the unit the effective drug_dose value is expressed

fields.name: dose_unit_source_value
fields.description: The information about the dose unit as detailed in the source

fields.name: drug_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard drug concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: drug_exposure_end_date
fields.description: The end date for the current instance of drug utilization. It is not available from all sources.

fields.name: drug_exposure_end_datetime
fields.description: The end date and time of the utilization of the drug

fields.name: drug_exposure_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each drug utilization event.

fields.name: drug_exposure_order_date
fields.description: The order date of the drug

fields.name: drug_exposure_order_datetime
fields.description: The order date and time of the drug

fields.name: drug_exposure_start_date
fields.description: The start date for the current instance of drug utilization. Valid entries include a start date of a prescription, the date a prescription was filled, or the date on which a drug administration procedure was recorded.

fields.name: drug_exposure_start_datetime
fields.description: The start date and time of the utilization of the drug. The start date of the prescription, the date the prescription was filled, the date a drug was dispensed or the date on which a drug administration procedure was recorded are acceptable.

fields.name: drug_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a drug concept that refers to the code used in the source

fields.name: drug_source_value
fields.description: The source drug value as it appears in the source data. The source is mapped to a standard RxNorm concept and the original code is stored here for reference.

fields.name: drug_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of the type of drug exposure in the Vocabulary as represented in the source data

fields.name: eff_drug_dose_source_value
fields.description: The drug dose for this drug_exposure record as it appears in the source

fields.name: effective_drug_dose
fields.description: Numerical value of drug dose for this drug_exposure record

fields.name: frequency
fields.description: The discrete frequency information as available from the source

fields.name: lot_number
fields.description: An identifier to determine where the product originated

fields.name: order_group_id
fields.description: Identifier used to group MAR actions from the same order togther.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who is subjected to the drug. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who initiated (prescribed) the drug exposure

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the drugs as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record

fields.name: refills
fields.description: The number of refills after the initial prescrition

fields.name: route_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard administration route concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: route_source_value
fields.description: The information about the route of administration as detailed in the source

fields.name: sig
fields.description: The directions on the drug prescription as recorded in the original prescription (and printed on the container) or the dispensing record

fields.name: stop_reason
fields.description: The reason, if available, where the medication was stopped, as indicated in the source data.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the drug exposure initiated.

tables.name: drug_strength
tables.description: The DRUG_STRENGTH table contains structured content about the amount or concentration and associated units of a specific ingredient within a particular drug product. The drug strength table is a supplemental file to support standardized analysis of drug utilization using concepts from the RxNorm vocabulary. A clinical drug concept which contains multiple active ingredients will result in one drug strength record for each active ingredient.

fields.name: amount_unit_concept_id
fields.description: The unit corresponding to the numeric value of the amount of the active ingredient contained within the product.

fields.name: amount_value
fields.description: The numeric value associated with the amount of active ingredient contained within the product, in situations when the ingredient is contained within a solid formulation.

fields.name: box_size
fields.description: The box size that corresponds to the active ingredient.

fields.name: denominator_unit_concept_id
fields.description: The denominator unit corresponding to the numeric value of the concentration of the active ingredient contained within the product.

fields.name: denominator_value
fields.description: The denominator of the numeric value associated with the concentration of the active ingredient contained within the product, in situations when the ingredient is contained within a non-solid formulation.

fields.name: drug_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept in the concept table, representing the identifier for an RxNorm branded drug or clinical drug concept.

fields.name: ingredient_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept in the concept table, representing the identifier for an RxNorm ingredient concept contained within the drug product.

fields.name: invalid_reason
fields.description: Reason the concept was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

fields.name: numerator_unit_concept_id
fields.description: The numerator unit corresponding to the numeric value of the concentration of the active ingredient contained within the product.

fields.name: numerator_value
fields.description: The numeric value associated with the concentration of the active ingredient contained within the product, in situations when the ingredient is contained within a non-solid formulation.

fields.name: valid_end_date
fields.description: The date when the concept became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new concept. The default value is 31-Dec-2099.

fields.name: valid_start_date
fields.description: The date when the concept was first recorded. The default value is 1-Jan-1970.

tables.name: fact_relationship
tables.description: The fact relationship domain contains details of the relationships between facts within one domain or across two domains, and the nature of the relationship.

fields.name: domain_concept_id_1
fields.description: The concept representing the domain of fact one, from which the corresponding table can be inferred.

fields.name: domain_concept_id_2
fields.description: The concept representing the domain of fact two, from which the corresponding table can be inferred.

fields.name: fact_id_1
fields.description: The unique identifier in the table corresponding to the domain of fact one.

fields.name: fact_id_2
fields.description: The unique identifier in the table corresponding to the domain of fact two.

fields.name: relationship_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of relationship in the Standardized Vocabularies.

tables.name: hash_token
tables.description: The 'Hash_Token' domain is intended to store encrypted and keyed secure hash tokens that are used to match patient records across DataMarts using privacy-preserving record linkage methods. This table requirement comes from the PCORnet data model.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Device. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

fields.name: token_01
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 01 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_02
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 02 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_03
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 03 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_04
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 04 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_05
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 05 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_06
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 06 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_07
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 07 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_08
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 08 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_09
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 09 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_101
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 101 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_102
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 102 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_103
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 103 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_104
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 104 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_105
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 105 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_106
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 106 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_107
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 107 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_108
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 108 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_109
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 109 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_110
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 110 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_111
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 111 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_12
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 12 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_14
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 14 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_15
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 15 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_16
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 16 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_17
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 17 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_18
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 18 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_23
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 23 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_24
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 24 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_25
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 25 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_26
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 26 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_29
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 29 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_30
fields.description: Encrypted keyed hash generated from PII using token strategy 30 in Datavant DeID.

fields.name: token_encryption_key
fields.description: The token encryption key used.

tables.name: immunization
tables.description: The immunization domain captures immunization records.

fields.name: imm_body_site_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the body site where the immunization was administered in the vocabulary.

fields.name: imm_body_site_source_value
fields.description: The body site where the immunization was administered in the source system.

fields.name: imm_dose_unit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a predefined concept in the Standard Vocabularies reflecting the unit the immunization_dose value is expressed

fields.name: imm_dose_unit_source_value
fields.description: The information about the immunization dose unit as detailed in the source

fields.name: imm_exp_date
fields.description: The date of the immunization expiration. No date shifting.

fields.name: imm_exp_datetime
fields.description: The date and time of the immunization expiration.No date shifting.

fields.name: imm_lot_num
fields.description: The information about the immunization lot number.

fields.name: imm_manufacturer
fields.description: The information about the immunization manufacturer.

fields.name: imm_recorded_date
fields.description: The date the immunization was recorded.This date is applicable for immunizations that have been reported by the patient and not administered at the visit. No date shifting.

fields.name: imm_recorded_datetime
fields.description: The time the immunization was recorded. This date and time is applicable for immunizations that have been reported by the patient and not administered at the visit. No date shifting.

fields.name: imm_route_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard administration route concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: imm_route_source_value
fields.description: The information about the route of administration as detailed in the source

fields.name: immunization_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard immunization concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: immunization_date
fields.description: The date for the administration of immunization.

fields.name: immunization_datetime
fields.description: The date and time of the administration of immunization.

fields.name: immunization_dose
fields.description: Numerical value of drug dose for this immunization record

fields.name: immunization_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each immunization event.

fields.name: immunization_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a immunization concept that refers to the code used in the source

fields.name: immunization_source_value
fields.description: The source immunization value as it appears in the source data. The source is mapped to a standard CVX concept and the original code is stored here for reference.

fields.name: immunization_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to source of immunization record.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who received the immunization. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: procedure_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the procedure associated with the immunization record.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who administered the immunization.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the visit associated with the immunization record.

tables.name: lab_site_mapping
tables.description: The 'Lab Site Mapping' table is intended to store local site mappings to the standard PEDSnet loinc codes.

fields.name: pedsnet_concept_id
fields.description: The concept id of the PEDSnet lab.

fields.name: pedsnet_lab_name
fields.description: The name of the PEDSnet lab.

fields.name: pedsnet_loinc_code
fields.description: The loinc code of the PEDSnet lab.

fields.name: site_loinc_code
fields.description: The site measurement loinc code that corresponds to the PEDSnet lab.

fields.name: site_measurement_concept_id
fields.description: The site measurement concept id that corresponds to the PEDSnet lab.

fields.name: site_source_value
fields.description: The site measurement source value that corresponds to the PEDSnet lab.

tables.name: location
tables.description: Physical addresses of patients, organizations and care sites

fields.name: address_1
fields.description: Optional - Do not transmit to DCC

fields.name: address_2
fields.description: Optional - Do not transmit to DCC

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city field as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: country_concept_id
fields.description: The standard concept for country.

fields.name: country_source_value
fields.description: The country field as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: county
fields.description: Optional - Do not transmit to DCC

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The longitude associated with the location.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each geographic location.

fields.name: location_source_value
fields.description: The verbatim information that is used to uniquely identify the location as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The latitude associated with the location.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state field as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The zip code. For US addresses, valid zip codes can be 3, 5 or 9 digits long, depending on the source data.

tables.name: location_fips
tables.description: Geocoded location data for each location_id down to the census block group level

fields.name: geocode_block
fields.description: Final 3 characters of a FIPS code that represents a block

fields.name: geocode_county
fields.description: Next 3 characters of a FIPS code that represents a county

fields.name: geocode_group
fields.description: Next 1 character of a FIPS code that represents a block group

fields.name: geocode_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each location_fips record.

fields.name: geocode_shapefile
fields.description: The name of the shapefile used in the geocoding process

fields.name: geocode_state
fields.description: First 2 characters of a FIPS code that represents a state

fields.name: geocode_tract
fields.description: Next 6 characters of a FIPS code that represents a census tract

fields.name: geocode_year
fields.description: The census year associated with the geocode (For example2010or2020)

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the location table, where the detailed address information is stored.

tables.name: location_history
tables.description: The 'Location_History' domain is intended to store historical location information for various domains persons, providers and care_sites.

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The domain of the entity that is related to the location. Either PERSON, PROVIDER, or CARE_SITE.For PEDSNet v3.5, only patient address histories are present in this table. Due to this the domain_id = Person for all records.

fields.name: end_date
fields.description: The date the relationship ended. This field should be NULL for the current location of the entity. No date shifting.

fields.name: end_datetime
fields.description: The date the relationship ended.This field should be NULL for the current location of the entity. No date shifting.

fields.name: entity_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the entity. References either person_id, provider_id, or care_site_id, depending on domain_id. For PEDSNet v3.5, only patient address histories are present in this table. Due to this, please populate this field with the corresponding person_id.

fields.name: location_history_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each measurement

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the location table.

fields.name: location_preferred_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that indicates if the location is the preferred location.For PEDSnet 3.5 value set = Yes/No and Flavors of null

fields.name: relationship_type_concept_id
fields.description: The type of relationship between location and entity.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: The date the relationship started. No date shifting.

fields.name: start_datetime
fields.description: The date the relationship started. No date shifting.

tables.name: measurement
tables.description: The measurement domain captures measurement orders and measurement results. The measurement domain can contain laboratory results and vital signs.

fields.name: measurement_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the standard measurement concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: measurement_date
fields.description: The date of the measurement.

fields.name: measurement_datetime
fields.description: The time of the measurement.

fields.name: measurement_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each measurement

fields.name: measurement_order_date
fields.description: This field applies to Lab Orders only. This is the date the lab was ordered in the source.

fields.name: measurement_order_datetime
fields.description: This field applies to Lab Orders only. This is the time the lab was ordered in the source.

fields.name: measurement_result_date
fields.description: This field applies to Lab Orders only. This is the date the lab resulted in the source.

fields.name: measurement_result_datetime
fields.description: This field applies to Lab Orders only. This is the time the lab resulted in the source.

fields.name: measurement_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: measurement_source_value
fields.description: The measurement name as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

fields.name: measurement_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept identifier in the Vocabulary reflecting the type of the measurement.

fields.name: operator_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the mathematical operator that is applied to the value_as_number.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who the measurement is being documented for. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: priority_concept_id
fields.description: This field applies to Lab Orders only. A foreign key to a concept that referes to the lab priority as described in the source

fields.name: priority_source_value
fields.description: This field applies to Lab Orders only. A foreign key to a concept that referes to the lab priority as described in the source

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was responsible for making the measurement.

fields.name: range_high
fields.description: The upper limit of the normal range of the measurement. It is not applicable if the observation results are non-numeric or categorical, and must be in the same units of measure as the measurement value.

fields.name: range_high_operator_concept_id
fields.description: A forign key to the modifier of higher limit of the normal range of the measurement as it appears in the source as a concept identifer.

fields.name: range_high_source_value
fields.description: The higher limit of the normal range of the measurement as it appears in the source.

fields.name: range_low
fields.description: The lower limit of the normal range of the measurement. It is not applicable if the observation results are non-numeric or categorical, and must be in the same units of measure as the measurement value.

fields.name: range_low_operator_concept_id
fields.description: A forign key to the modifier of lower limit of the normal range of the measurement as it appears in the source as a concept identifer.

fields.name: range_low_source_value
fields.description: The lower limit of the normal range of the measurement as it appears in the source.

fields.name: specimen_concept_id
fields.description: This field is applicable for lab values only. A foreign key to a concept that refers to the specimen source.

fields.name: specimen_source_value
fields.description: This field is applicable for lab values only. This source value for the specimen source as it appears in the source

fields.name: unit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of measurement units in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: unit_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of measurement units in the Vocabulary as it appears in the source.

fields.name: unit_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the unit as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard unit concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

fields.name: value_as_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to an observation result stored as a concept identifier. This is applicable to observations where the result can be expressed as a standard concept from the Vocabulary (e.g., positive/negative, present/absent, low/high, etc.).

fields.name: value_as_number
fields.description: The measurement result stored as a number. This is applicable to measurements where the result is expressed as a numeric value.

fields.name: value_source_value
fields.description: The source value associated with the structured value stored as numeric or concept. This field can be used in instances where the source data are transformed

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the observation was recorded.

tables.name: measurement_organism
tables.description: The measurement organism table contains organism information related to laboratory culture results in the measurement table.

fields.name: meas_organism_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each organism culture relationship.

fields.name: measurement_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the lab result in the measurement table where the organism was observed.

fields.name: organism_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier for the organism in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: organism_source_value
fields.description: The organism value as it appears in the source.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who the measurement is being documented for.

fields.name: positivity_datetime
fields.description: The estimated date and time of initial growth as reported in the source.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit where the culture lab was ordered

tables.name: observation
tables.description: Observations are clinical facts, such as laboratory tests, signs/symptoms, which are not captured within other CDM tables

fields.name: observation_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the standard observation concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: observation_date
fields.description: The date of the observation.

fields.name: observation_datetime
fields.description: The time of the observation.

fields.name: observation_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each observation.

fields.name: observation_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: observation_source_value
fields.description: The observation code as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard concept in the Vocabulary and the original code is, stored here for reference.

fields.name: observation_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept identifier in the Vocabulary reflecting the type of the observation.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person about whom the observation was recorded. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was responsible for making the observation.

fields.name: qualifier_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to standard concept identifier for a qualifier (e.g severity of drug-drug interaction alert)

fields.name: qualifier_source_value
fields.description: The source value associated with a qualifier to characterize the observation

fields.name: unit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier of measurement units in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: unit_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the unit as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard unit concept in the Vocabulary and the original code is, stored here for reference.

fields.name: value_as_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to an observation result stored as a concept identifier. This is applicable to observations where the result can be expressed as a standard concept from the Vocabulary (e.g., positive/negative, present/absent, low/high, etc.).

fields.name: value_as_number
fields.description: The observation result stored as a number. This is applicable to observations where the result is expressed as a numeric value.

fields.name: value_as_string
fields.description: The observation result stored as a string. This is applicable to observations where the result is expressed as verbatim text.

fields.name: value_source_value
fields.description: The observation result stored as it appears in the source.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the observation was recorded.

tables.name: observation_period
tables.description: Time intervals during which health care information, such as drugs, conditions, and other clinical observations, may be available

fields.name: observation_period_end_date
fields.description: The end date of the observation period for which data are available from the source.

fields.name: observation_period_end_time
fields.description: The end date of the observation period for which data are available from the source.

fields.name: observation_period_id
fields.description: A system-generate unique identifier for each observation period

fields.name: observation_period_start_date
fields.description: The start date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source

fields.name: observation_period_start_time
fields.description: The start date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source

fields.name: period_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the predefined concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the source of the observation period information

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who is experiencing the condition. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

tables.name: person
tables.description: Demographic information about a Person

fields.name: birth_date
fields.description: The persons birthday. Full Date. Enter as much information as is available.

fields.name: birth_datetime
fields.description: The time of birth at the birthday. In order to reduce ambiguity around timezone shifts, this field is stored and transmitted as a full date and time without timezone information or conversion. Enter as much information as is available.

fields.name: care_site_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the site of primary care in the care_site table, where the details of the care site are stored

fields.name: day_of_birth
fields.description: The day of the month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the day is extracted and stored in this field.

fields.name: ethnicity_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the standard concept identifier in the Vocabulary for the ethnicity of the person.

fields.name: ethnicity_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the ethnicity concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: ethnicity_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the ethnicity of the person as it appears in the source data. The person ethnicity is mapped to a standard ethnicity concept in the Vocabulary and the original code is, stored here for reference.

fields.name: gender_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the Vocabulary for the gender of the person.

fields.name: gender_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the gender concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: gender_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the gender of the person as it appears in the source data. The persons gender is mapped to a standard gender concept in the Vocabulary; the original value is stored here for reference.

fields.name: language_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the standard concept identifier in the Vocabulary for the language of the person.

fields.name: language_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the language concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: language_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the language of the person as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the place of residency (ZIP code) for the person in the location table, where the detailed address information is stored.

fields.name: month_of_birth
fields.description: The month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the month is extracted and stored in this field.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each person; this is created by each contributing site. Note: This is not a value found in the EHR. However, a map to patient ID or MRN from the EHR must be kept at the site and not shared with the data coordinating center for re-identification in the future.

fields.name: person_source_value
fields.description: An encrypted key derived from the person identifier in the source data. For site-specific data extracts, this may be identical to the person_id.

fields.name: pn_gestational_age
fields.description: The post-menstrual age in weeks of the person at birth, if known.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: Foreign key to the primary care provider  the person is seeing in the provider table.

fields.name: race_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the Vocabulary for the race of the person.

fields.name: race_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the race concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: race_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the race of the person as it appears in the source data. The person race is mapped to a standard race concept in the Vocabulary and the original value is stored here for reference.

fields.name: year_of_birth
fields.description: The year of birth of the person. For data sources with date of birth, the year is extracted. For data sources where the year of birth is not available, the approximate year of birth is derived based on any age group categorization available.

tables.name: procedure_occurrence
tables.description: Procedures carried out on the Person

fields.name: modifier_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a standard concept identifier for a modifier to the procedure (e.g. bilateral)

fields.name: modifier_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the modifier as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person who is subjected to the procedure. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: procedure_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard procedure concept identifier in the Vocabulary.

fields.name: procedure_date
fields.description: The date on which the procedure was performed.

fields.name: procedure_datetime
fields.description: The date and time on which the procedure was performed. If there is no time associated with the date assert midnight.

fields.name: procedure_end_date
fields.description: The date on which the procedure ended performed.

fields.name: procedure_end_datetime
fields.description: The date and time on which the procedure ended. If there is no time associated with the date assert midnight.

fields.name: procedure_occurrence_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each procedure occurrence. Sites can use any integer- DCC will do a substitution.

fields.name: procedure_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a procedure concept that refers to the code used in the source. For example, if the procedure is "Anesthesia for procedures on eye; lens surgery" in the source which has a concept code in the vocabulary that is 2100658. The procedure source concept id will be 2100658.

fields.name: procedure_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the procedure as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard procedure concept in the Vocabulary and the original code is, stored here for reference. Procedure source codes are typically ICD-9-Proc, ICD-10-Proc, CPT-4, HCPCS or OPCS-4 codes.

fields.name: procedure_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept identifier in the Vocabulary reflecting the type of source data from which the procedure record is derived.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was responsible for carrying out the procedure.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of procedures ordered or administered.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table during which the procedure was carried out.

tables.name: provider
tables.description: Information about health care providers

fields.name: care_site_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the main care site where the provider is practicing. This field is required in PEDSnet, which is a deviation from OMOP CDM V4.

fields.name: dea
fields.description: The Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) number of the provider. Optional  Do not transmit to DCC.

fields.name: gender_concept_id
fields.description: The gender of the provider

fields.name: gender_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: gender_source_value
fields.description: The source value for the provider gender.

fields.name: npi
fields.description: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the provider. Optional  Do not transmit to DCC.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each provider. Each site must maintain a map from this value to the identifier used for the provider in the source data.

fields.name: provider_name
fields.description: A description of the provider.

fields.name: provider_source_value
fields.description: The identifier used for the provider in the source data, stored here for reference. Sites should create a random ID, but keep the mapping.

fields.name: specialty_concept_id
fields.description: The specialty of the department linked to a standard specialty concept as it appears in the Vocabulary

fields.name: specialty_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the code used in the source

fields.name: specialty_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the specialty as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

fields.name: year_of_birth
fields.description: The year of birth of the provider

tables.name: relationship
tables.description: The RELATIONSHIP table provides a reference list of all allowable types of relationships that can be used to associate any two concepts in the concept relationship table. Relationships are classified as hierarchical (parent-child) or non-hierarchical, and are used to determine which concept relationship records should be included in the computation of the concept ancestor table.

fields.name: defines_ancestry
fields.description: Defines whether a hierarchical relationship contributes to the concept_ancestor table. These are subsets of the hierarchical relationships. Valid values are 1 or 0.

fields.name: is_hierarchical
fields.description: Defines whether a relationship defines concepts into classes or hierarchies. Values are 1 for hierarchical relationship or 0 if not.

fields.name: relationship_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the relationship concept.

fields.name: relationship_id
fields.description: The type of relationship captured by the relationship record.

fields.name: relationship_name
fields.description: The text that describes the relationship type.

fields.name: reverse_relationship_id
fields.description: The identifier for the relationship used to define the reverse relationship between two concepts.

tables.name: source_to_concept_map
tables.description: The SOURCE_TO_CONCEPT_MAP table is a legacy data structure within the OMOP Common Data Model, recommended for use in extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes to maintain local source codes which are not available as concepts in the Standardized Vocabularies, and to establish mappings for each source code into a standard concept that can be used to populate the Common Data Model tables. The source to concept map table is no longer populated with content within the Standardized Vocabularies published to the OMOP community.

fields.name: invalid_reason
fields.description: Reason the mapping instance was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

fields.name: source_code
fields.description: The source code being translated into a standard concept.

fields.name: source_code_description
fields.description: An optional description for the source code. This is included as a convenience to compare the description of the source code to the name of the concept.

fields.name: source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the source concept to which the source code is being mapped.

fields.name: source_vocabulary_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the vocabulary table defining the vocabulary of the source code that is being mapped to the standard vocabulary.

fields.name: target_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the concept to which the source code is being mapped.

fields.name: target_vocabulary_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the vocabulary table defining the vocabulary of the target concept.

fields.name: valid_end_date
fields.description: The date when the mapping instance became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new relationship. Default value is 31-Dec-2099.

fields.name: valid_start_date
fields.description: The date when the mapping instance was first recorded.

tables.name: specialty
tables.description: Specification on priority of specialties for providers and care sites (primary, secondary, etc)

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The domain of the entity that is related to the specialty. Either PROVIDER or CARE_SITE.

fields.name: entity_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the entity. References either provider_id or care_site_id depending on domain_id.

fields.name: entity_type_concept_id
fields.description: concept_id that represents the hierarchical order of the specialty record as it is associated with the domain_id + entity_id record (i.e. with the given PROVIDER or CARESITE).

fields.name: specialty_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to the given PROVIDER or CARESITE specialty.

fields.name: specialty_id
fields.description: a unique identifier for each specialty instance in the table.

fields.name: specialty_source_value
fields.description: The Specialty Name as it appears in the source data.

tables.name: visit_occurrence
tables.description: Visits for health care services of the Person

fields.name: admitted_from_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: admitted_from_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the admitting source as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: care_site_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the care site in the care site table that was visited.

fields.name: discharged_to_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: discharged_to_source_value
fields.description: The source code for the discharge disposition as it appears in the source data.

fields.name: person_id
fields.description: A foreign key identifier to the person for whom the visit is recorded. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.

fields.name: preceding_visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table record of the visit immediately preceding this visit.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was associated with the visit. NOTE: this is NOT in OMOP CDM v4, but appears in OMOP CDMv5. PEDSnet is including the field at this time due to an existing use case (Obesity cohort).

fields.name: visit_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a place of service concept identifier in the vocabulary.

fields.name: visit_end_date
fields.description: The end date of the visit. If this is a one-day visit the end date should match the start date. If the encounter is on-going at the time of ETL, this should be null.

fields.name: visit_end_datetime
fields.description: The end time of the visit.

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each persons visits or encounter at a healthcare provider. Sites can provide whatever integers (DCC will replace the value).

fields.name: visit_source_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the code used in the source.

fields.name: visit_source_value
fields.description: The source code used to reflect the type or source of the visit in the source data. Valid entries include office visits, hospital admissions, etc. These source codes can also be type-of service codes and activity type codes.

fields.name: visit_start_date
fields.description: The start date of the visit.

fields.name: visit_start_datetime
fields.description: The start time of the visit.

fields.name: visit_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of source data from which the visit record is derived.

tables.name: visit_payer
tables.description: The visit payer table documents insurance information as it relates to a visit in visit_occurrence. For this reason the key of this table will be visit_occurrence_id and visit_payer_id.

fields.name: plan_class
fields.description: A list of the "payment sources" most often used in demographic analyses; proposed value would be Private/commercial, Medicaid/sCHIP, Medicare, Other public, Self-pay, Other/unknown

fields.name: plan_name
fields.description: The untransformed payer/plan name from the source data

fields.name: plan_type
fields.description: A standardized interpretation of the plan structure; proposed value set would be HMO, PPO, POS, Fee for service, Other/unknown

fields.name: visit_occurrence_id
fields.description: A foreign key to the visit in the visit table where the payer was billed for the visit.

fields.name: visit_payer_id
fields.description: A system-generated unique identifier for each visit payer relationship.

fields.name: visit_payer_type_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key to a concept that refers to the status of the payer in the source.

tables.name: vocabulary
tables.description: The VOCABULARY table includes a list of the vocabularies collected from various sources or created de novo by the OMOP community. This reference table is populated with a single record for each vocabulary source and includes a descriptive name and other associated attributes for the vocabulary.

fields.name: vocabulary_concept_id
fields.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the vocabulary the Vocabulary record belongs to.

fields.name: vocabulary_id
fields.description: A unique identifier for each vocabulary.

fields.name: vocabulary_name
fields.description: The name describing the vocabulary, for example "SNOMED-CT", "ICD-9", "Visit", etc.

fields.name: vocabulary_reference
fields.description: The name describing the vocabulary, for example "SNOMED-CT", "ICD-9", "Visit", etc.

fields.name: vocabulary_version
fields.description: External reference to documentation or available download of the about the vocabulary.
